data.title: Lunch
data.text: Went Thier for lunch and the Pho their is very good at a resonable price, the service is quick and attentive. Be prepared to wait for a table because they are always busy but it's worth the wait.

data.title: Average Pho noodle
data.text: A friend recommend me to try this place.  I tried beef noodle, "Pho tai" and found it was average.  As a Vietnamese and a Pho aficionado, I detected that rice noodles came from dried package, recooked in hot water and not freshly prepared.  It is possible that they ran out of fresh noodles.  Also, the saying "where is the beef?" is applicable here.  It would be nice to boost up the meat for such a large portion of noodles.

data.title: Wow!  What a great Vietnamese restaurant find!
data.text:
The nondescript entrance, surrounded by several bails-bond storefronts belies what an exceptional restuarant lieu within!  In the hear of downtown, near the courthouse, this gem was packed on Saturday 1:00pm and we had to wait a good 15 minutes.  Well worth it!

It is not just the Pho that stands out here (but it was some of the best I've had), the spring rolls are such a delight of chewy, delicious pork and fresh shrimp. Makes you wonder about all the tasteless spring rolls you get other places!  Cocunut shrimp was also tasty.  However the star was the glazed BBQ pork and shrimp.  OMG was it great!

Combo Pho had a great broth and I tried it because it contains tripe, tendons as well as the other meat goodies.  If the can do those two meats well you know its great and they excelled!  No smell or sliminess just great tender flavors.

Highly recommended.  I will go back again and again...

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: Since I usually dine in San Francisco at Asian noodle houses I was quite surprised to find this noodle restaurant here in Modesto. The place was packed as it gets a large lunch crowd of downtown workers. The food was very good and service was excellent.

data.title: Outstanding pho and chow mein
data.text: I eat a lot of asian food. I eat a lot of noodle soup. This place is a little hidden gem in the heart of Modesto. I make the drive just to eat here.  I have eaten here 6 or 7 times now and have not been disappointed yet. The noodle soup is to die for.  The chow mein?  The best I have ever eaten. This is not you local Panda! This is quality authentic asian food-second to none.

data.title: Great food
data.text: While staying in Modesto for the weekend,  came across this little hidden treasures of an eatery. Had Pho and Mongolian Beef,  was very impressed,  will definitely dine there again. Little hard to find even with GPS,  but well worth the search.

data.title: A popular pho restaurant
data.text: This place is always packed.  Not sure why, but it always attracts a hip crowd.  The food is good, and very reasonably priced.  Like most pho places, you can even share a meal which is not only very tasty, but cheaper than fast food.

data.title: Delicious, flavorful, and a great deal!
data.text: I had the pho with everything in it... two kinds of shaved steak, tripe, and tendon. It was delicious. The broth was rich and deeply flavorful, and the noodles were cooked perfectly. I ordered the small, and still had plenty left to take home for a midnight snack later, so I can also add that the portions are a great value.

data.title: Good Food, Would Go Back
data.text:
I did not eat there, but instead got my order to go, but I enjoyed the food I got. My friend recommended the place, he eats there frequently. He got the chicken vermicelli which he likes a lot, I got Chicken Pho with extra veggies. They were generous with the serving, it was way more food then I could eat. Even to go it was more then enough herbs and spices, as if I was there eating. 

I will go again. They did not get 5 stars because the lady was a little rude on the phone when taking my order. Side note, they only have can soda...

Give them a try if you are in the Mo!!!!

data.title: Great place to eat in modesto
data.text: If you're looking for an inexpensive great place in Modesto to eat the Phoenix noodle house is the place. Great fresh food with great service. Not a big place so you might have to wait if you get there after 6pm. But it is definitely worth the wait.

data.title: Hotel Council Meeting
data.text: The food was very good. The Pho was awesome and some unique dishes. Had a chance to try many things out and will definitely be back.

data.title: Traditional Pho.. but with a layer of grease on top!
data.text: A very cramped, hot little restaurant.. The Pho was traditional and had potential except for the broth (which in Pho is Everything!!) Theirs was tasteless and had a gross layer of grease on top.. Ick!

data.title: Great pho for being in Modesto
data.text:
I was recently in Modesto running the marathon in March - my usual pre race meal involves noodles of some kind, so I went in search of some pho. Being from the Bay Area (pho capital), I didn't have very high expectations for pho in the Central Valley. This place looked very unassuming from the outside, and was located next to all these bail bond places. 

Lesson learned: Never judge a book by it's cover. The pho here was amazing! Rivaled some of the better pho I've had in San Francisco / San Jose. The broth was super flavorful, and they had a good portion of noodles to beef to broth. The only thing they lacked though, was all the garnishes - no mint for the pho. Also, the beef was a little tough, but that's not a big deal.

The service here is also super friendly and on key. Very nice servers, took the time to explain stuff to the table next to us (I guess they had never had pho before) and didn't feel rushed at all.

data.title: Excellent food, great prices, large portions!
data.text: Restaurant is clean, food is delicious and portions are huge.  This place gets packed during lunch time so when time is an issue I call my order in and pick it up "to go". Everything here is excellent so you won't be disappointed with anything you choose.  One of my favorites (right now) is the vegetable pho, I always ask for fresh basil to shred up on the top...so yummy and comforting.  Most of the gals in my office order the Vermicelli Noodle Bowl.  Egg rolls here are really good too...it all is!

data.title: Best pho in town
data.text: I eat here about once a month they have great service friendly servers and best of all great food the only drawback is the restaurant is a little small so it fills up quickly but it is worth the wait I recommend it to everyone you will not leave hungry and the prices are perfect..

data.title: great food, great service, great vibes
data.text: I have been going there since I was a kid, with family, and now I go all the time, calling in orders ahead of time, it's always ready, always warm, always great

data.title: Every time.   Never a let down.
data.text: Went to lunch as i was downtown at a conference.  We called ahead of time for table for 8 since this is a popular place.  They really need to expand for lunch and dinner crowds.  You can call at 11 and request reservations for large parties.  Anyhow the vermicelli bowls are outstanding.  War won ton soup.  The medium bowls of soup will feed two.  The large bowls will feed easily three.  I got the spring rolls.  I usually also order the egg rolls but I find its way too much food.   Always yummy.  Fresh.  Prices are fair. Reasonable.

data.title: Great fresh food
data.text: Went here on the recommendation of a colleague and was not disappointed! It was a hot evening when we went so we had the bun (vermicelli noodles) instead of the pho but I can't wait to go back and try the pho! I had the bun with prawns and it was delicious! My boyfriend had the beef but shrimp is the way to go! They are grilled with a great marinade!

data.title: Wonderful Gem!
data.text: Located in downtown Modesto, this place is great! The employees are friendly and attentive! She was great at knowing when I needs refills. I have grown up eating pho and this pho is good! I've eaten at other Vietnamese places in Modesto and this is the best I've had. They have 3 different sizes of pho depending on how hungry you are. I also ordered some rolls and they were tasty too! I ordered them with the fish sauce instead of the peanut sauce cause I'm allergic and it was good! They can get busy but this place is worth it!

data.title: Delicious comfort food
data.text: It was a cold and windy night and all I could think about was how good a nice hot bowl of Pho sounded.   Friends/family and reviews directed us here, and we were not disappointed!   Our server was kind enough to seat us away from the door because it was so cold outside, and sat us up on the balcony upstairs.  The Pho was fantastic, and the portions are HUGE!  Believe me, a medium bowl of Pho is more than enough for one person!   We will be back whenever we're back in town.
